title: Unify checking for libnccl in setup.py and build_all.sh
body_html:
In order to install pytorch with a user installed nccl the following steps are needed:

to satisfy setup.py:
Add .../nccl/build/lib in /etc/ld.so.conf
run ldconfig

to satisfy build_all.sh:
export CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=".../nccl/build":$CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH

to satisfy the linker:
export LIBRARY_PATH=".../nccl/build/lib/":$LIBRARY_PATH

is there a way we could unify these steps to make the process more straight forward?

Another problem may arise if the nccl is installed without the header. It may be worth having setup.py try to locate the header and give a descriptive error if it is not found with the library.
